page.title: 14 BRIMFIELD COMMON
page.content: {Brimfield Common}is thirty two and a half acres in size. We think it now belongs to the local Council but we are not sure. If you buy a house on or near the Common you usually buy some {Common rights,}these allow you to keep so many animals on the Common, the exact number of each type are stated in the deeds of the house.The road across the Common is very rough indeed and we think it ought to be looked after a little better! Most of the land is used for{grazing}but some of it is unfit because it is so marshy. We saw cows, sheep and goats when we visited it. Some of the birds we saw were{magpies, peewits, crows and {robins.}There are quite a few houses around the edge of the Common, some of their names are: Little Shortgrove, Adams Cottage, The Hollies, Prestley Croft, Elmleigh and Tinknor Cottage.
